doc.title: Series (A)
doc.source_uri: 2025-08-30/2Q25 at the midpoint of preliminary new M7 launch on 23rd Sep PO to RMB1602Q25 at the midpoint of preliminary new M7 lau_2025-08-30

passages.text: Reiterate Rating: BUY | PO: 160.00 CNY | Price: 136.91 CNY

Seres 2Q25 revenue was RMB43.3bn, up \(12\%\) YoY/ \(126\%\) QoQ. 2Q25 GPM was \(29.5\%\) up 3.7ppt YoY/1.9ppt QoQ, helped by more sales contribution from AITO M9 & M8. 2Q25 operating margin (clean EBIT) came in at \(5.9\%\) , up 3.3ppt YoY/3.7ppt QoQ, aided by better scale. 2Q25 net income was RMB2.2bn, up \(57\%\) YoY/ \(193\%\) QoQ, at the midpoint of preliminary 2Q25 net profit at RMB2.0- 2.5bn. Excluding one- off items (mainly government subsidy), 2Q25 net income came in at RMB2.1bn, up \(57\%\) YoY/ \(428\%\) QoQ. Volume sales breakdown by model, M9/M8/M7/M5 reported \(39k / 41k / 13k / 14k\) units vs. M9/M7/M5 reported \(23k / 18k / 4k\) in 1Q25. Net profit per vehicle (AITO brand) came in at RMB21k in 2Q25, vs. RMB17k in 1Q25.

Series launched AITO M8 BEV version on 25 August and received 10k units non- refundable orders in one day (vs. M8 EREV version received 32k units non- refundable orders in one day after its launch in April). Prices of M8 BEV version came in at RMB360- 450k (same price range as EREV version). Moving on to new AITO M7, it is expected to launch on 23 September; BEV version will be added on top of existing EREV version; there will be major upgrades in chassis system, exterior design and interior. Of note, 2024 version AITO M7 is priced at RMB250- 330k, while its monthly sales dropped to 5k units in 7M25 vs. 16k units in 2024. We expect launch of new AITO M7 will boost M7 volume sales but may dilute M8 volume sales.

Factoring in 2Q25 results and the latest outlook, we lift 2025/26/27E revenue by \(4\% /11\% /9\%\) , and raise 2025/26/27E OPM by 0.3ppt/0.2ppt/0.5ppt. Net- net, we lift 2025/26/27E EPS by \(1\% /5\% /9\%\) . Our new PO of RMB160 (RMB155 previously) is based on average of DCF and P/E valuation (see details inside). We reiterate our Buy on Seres, for AITO's strong brand equity, robust model portfolios to driver Seres' earnings expansion.
\\* For full definitions of Qnethod\\* measures, see page 8.
>> Employed by a non- US affiliate of BofAS and is not registered/qualified as a research analyst under the FINRA rules.
Refer to "Other Important Disclosures" for information on certain BofA Securities entities that take responsibility for the information herein in particular jurisdictions.

BofA Securities does and seeks to do business with issuers covered in its research reports. As a result, investors should be aware that the firm may have a conflict of interest that could affect the objectivity of this report. Investors should consider this report as only a single factor in making their investment decision.
Refer to important disclosures on page 9 to 11. Analyst Certification on page 6. Price Objective Basis/Risk on page 6.
Ming Hsun Lee, CFA >> Research Analyst Merrill Lynch (Hong Kong)
Fiona Liang >> Research Analyst Merrill Lynch (Hong Kong)
Jessie Lo >> Research Analyst Merrill Lynch (Singapore)

Key Metrics \\* For full definitions of iQmethod measures, see page 8.
Autos/Car Manufacturers

Founded in 1986, Seres Group (previously known as Chongqing Soken Industry Group Co., Ltd) is an automotive manufacturer located in Chongqing, China. Seres's products include PVs (AITO, Seres & Landian, Dongfeng Fengguang), CVs (Dongfeng Soken, and Ruichi NEV) and auto components. AITO brand accounted for \(91\%\) of Seres's revenue in 2024.

We have a Buy rating on Seres. We expect Seres' growth to be helped by AITO brand. We believe AITO brand will stand out as a premium EV brand, thanks to (1) strong brand equity - well known for ADAS, smart functions, safety, comfort and space, (2) robust model portfolios and new generation of M9, M8, M7, M5, (3) leading ADAS solutions.
Price to Book Value 12.0x
2Q25 net income came in at RMB2.2bn, up 56% YoY/193% QoQ
Source: BofA Global Research estimates, company report
BofA GLOBAL RESEARCH
Source: BofA Global Research estimates
Exhibit 3:Quarterly P&L summary
Source: BofA Global Research estimates, company report
We derive our PO of RMB160 (previously RMB155), based on the average of DCF valuation method and P/E valuation method.

We derive a fair value of RMB168 (was RMB164) from our DCF calculation, with assumptions of \(2\%\) FCF perpetuity growth and WACC of \(14.4\%\) (was \(14.3\%\) , due to change of capital structure). DCF- based value is higher to mainly reflect higher FCF forecast.

We derive our P/E- based valuation of RMB153 (was RMB146) by applying a target P/E of \(23x\) (unchanged) to Seres's 2H25- 1H26E EPS. Our target P/E multiple is based on the company's average PER in the past one year at \(23x\) . We use historical average to reflect that Seres enters into stabilized growth stage.
Exhibit 4: Valuation Our PO for Series is RMB160
Valuation methodologyImplied value (RMB)Potential UpsideParametersMethodology 1DCF168WACC of 14.4%Methodology 2P/E multiple15323xPrice Objective16016.9%
Source: BofA Global Research estimates
We derive our PO of RMB160, based on the average of DCF valuation method and P/E valuation method.
We derive a fair value of RMB168 from our DCF calculation, with assumptions of \(2\%\) FCF perpetuity growth and WACC of \(14.4\%\)

We derive our P/E- based valuation of RMB153 by applying a target P/E of \(23x\) to Seres's 2H25- 1H26E EPS. Our target P/E multiple is based on the company's average PER in the past one year at \(23x\)

We believe the PER (price/earnings ratio) in the past one year better reflects the company's latest growth outlook, given (1) Seres's major brand AITO started its new model cycle since September 2023 (new \(M7 + M9\) ) and saw volume sales ramp up in 4Q23 and 2024, (2) Prior to that, Seres recorded net loss in 2020- 2023 due to the small scale of AITO volume sales could not cover R&D and sales & marketing expense on AITO brand development. We use the company's historical average PER, as Seres is expected to enter a stabilized growth stage, v.s. previous stage in 2023- 2024 when it turns from running at a loss to profit- making.
Downside risks to our PO are: macro factors that would negatively impact growth, new model failures, and competition from premium EV segment.

iQmethodis the set of BofA Global Research standard measures that serve to maintain global consistency under three broad headings: Business Performance, Quality of Earnings, and validations. The key features of
iQmethod are: A consistently structured, detailed, and transparent methodology. Guidelines to maximize the effectiveness of the comparative valuation process, and to identify some common pitfalls.

iQatobase* is our real-time global research database that is sourced directly from our equity analysts' earnings models and includes forecasted as well as historical data for income statements, balance sheets, and cash
flow statements for companies covered by BofA Global Research.
iQprofileiQmethod* are service marks of Bank of America Corporation. iQatobase* is a registered service mark of Bank of America Corporation.

From time to time research analysts conduct site visits of covered issuers. BofA Global Research policies prohibit research analysts from accepting payment or reimbursement for travel expenses from the issuer for such visits.
